skill.name: fluidsim
skill.description: Framework for computational fluid dynamics simulations using Python. Use when running fluid dynamics simulations including Navier-Stokes equations (2D/3D), shallow water equations, stratified flows, or when analyzing turbulence, vortex dynamics, or geophysical flows. Provides pseudospectral methods with FFT, HPC support, and comprehensive output analysis.

content.user_title: Run CFD simulations with Python-based FluidSim
content.value_statement: FluidSim brings high-performance computational fluid dynamics to Python. Run Navier-Stokes simulations, analyze turbulence, and visualize results with simple Python commands. No complex Fortran or C++ setup required.
actual_capabilities: Run 2D and 3D Navier-Stokes simulations with pseudospectral methods
Configure simulation parameters for viscosity, domain size, and resolution
Analyze turbulence spectra and vortex dynamics with visualization tools
Support for stratified flows and shallow water equations for geophysical flows
MPI parallelization for high-resolution and high-performance simulations
Load and analyze previous simulations with comprehensive output analysis
limitations: Periodic boundary conditions only - no wall boundaries or inflow-outflow
Requires FFT libraries for pseudospectral methods
Limited to incompressible flows in current solver implementations

best_practices: Use powers of 2 for grid resolution (128, 256, 512) for optimal FFT performance
Enable CFL condition with CFL=0.5 for stable adaptive time stepping
Save physical fields sparingly to manage disk space, use spatial means for time series
Test with lower resolution first before scaling to production runs
anti_patterns: Do not use arbitrary grid sizes - stick to powers of 2 for FFT efficiency
Avoid setting fixed time steps without CFL checking for turbulent flows
Do not save every time step - use appropriate output periods to manage data volume

faq.question: Why are my simulations unstable?
faq.answer: Ensure CFL condition is enabled or use sufficiently small time step. Check viscosity values are not too low for your resolution.

faq.question: How do I choose the right solver?
faq.answer: Use ns2d for 2D turbulence, ns3d for 3D flows, strat solvers for density-stratified flows, and sw1l for rotating shallow systems.

faq.question: What is the maximum resolution I can run?
faq.answer: Depends on available memory. A 512x512x512 simulation needs about 8GB RAM. Use MPI parallelization for higher resolutions.

faq.question: How do I restart a simulation?
faq.answer: Use params.init_fields.type='from_file' and point to the state file in your simulation directory.

faq.question: Can I run this on my laptop?
faq.answer: Yes for 2D simulations up to 512x512 resolution. For 3D or high-resolution runs, use a workstation or cluster with more memory.

faq.question: Why use pseudospectral methods?
faq.answer: Spectral methods provide high accuracy for periodic domains and efficient computation of derivatives via FFT algorithms.
